definition: male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Because of the interview time has not yet arrived, wei wei into mans room in shoes.
sentences.chinese: 因面試時間還未到來，魏薇誤入男廁所換鞋。

sentences.english: Where is the men's toilet, please?
After six months, the artwork in the women's room will move to the men's room and vice versa .
sentences.chinese: 半年後，女廁的畫作和男廁的畫作將交換場地。

sentences.english: Excuse me. Can you tell me which way the nearest men's room be?
sentences.chinese: 對不起。請問附近的男廁所在哪兒？

sentences.english: Since you're a boy, you should go to the Men's.
sentences.chinese: 既然你是男孩，所以你得上男廁所。

sentences.english: I was the doofus that got stuck in the men's room.
sentences.chinese: 我就是被困在男廁所裏的笨蛋。

sentences.english: With his other hand he pushed open the heavy men’s-room door.
sentences.chinese: 他用另一隻手推開男廁所沉重的門。

sentences.english: We went into the hallway to find the men's room.
sentences.chinese: 我們走進過道去找男廁所。

sentences.english: Excuse me, where is the gentlemen's toilet?

definition: the back door/fig. under the counter (indirect way for influence or pressure)/anus
to go by a roundabout route/to take a detour/(medicine or civil engineering) bypass
to recognize people (of babies)/to be able to tell people apart
the road one must follow or take/the only way/same as 必由之路[bi4 you2 zhi1 lu4]
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to get out of the way/to step aside
